Hi Seeker_E—appreciate how thoughtfully you’re approaching this.

[TALK]

In terms of signals beyond the careers page: the most reliable indicator would be a *new* or *materially updated* posting (e.g., new requisition ID, meaningfully different scope/level/team, or the role being reposted with updated requirements). If you see that kind of change, it’s reasonable to reapply at that point and reference your prior process.

If nothing has changed on the posting, a good rule of thumb is to avoid periodic check-ins—there isn’t an internal “status signal” we can share, and we wouldn’t want you spending cycles on outreach that won’t move things forward. If you do want a single, non-noisy follow-up, waiting ~2–3 months *and only if the role is newly reposted or materially revised* is the most sensible window.

Thanks again for your professionalism, and if a genuinely different need opens up that aligns, we’ll reach out based on the information we already have on file.
